turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hey, I'm looking for some new games to play. I'm really into RPGs and strategy games. Any recommendations?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Certainly! Based on your preferences for RPGs and strategy games, I can offer some suggestions. For RPGs, have you played the 'Witcher 3' or 'Divinity: Original Sin 2'? In terms of strategy, 'Civilization VI' or 'Stellaris' are excellent choices.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Yeah, I've played all of those! Anything a little less...mainstream? Maybe something with a cool art style or unique gameplay?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Okay, I understand. Hmm... for RPGs with unique gameplay, consider 'Disco Elysium'. It's a detective RPG with a very unconventional skill system. For strategy games with a cool art style, 'Into the Breach' is a good pick, though the gameplay can be quite challenging.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Into the Breach sounds familiar. But I'm not sure if I can handle challenging. What about something that blends RPG and strategy elements? And bonus points if it has a good story!

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Ah, a good combination! Try 'Pathfinder: Wrath of the Righteous'. It's a fantastic RPG with turn-based and real-time with pause combat, and the story is quite engaging. There are also some base-building elements. Or, for a different approach, 'Warhammer 40,000: Gladius - Relics of War', though the story is not its strongest point. Hope that helps!

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Perfect! Wrath of the Righteous sounds like exactly what I was looking for. Thanks for the suggestions, that was very helpful!
